River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Shane Meadows to subtitles all but dismantles their entire production. A complicated tale could have been told with a little less portentousness, if they had simply acted the scenes out and allowed Meadows to leave the audience with questions he really has no business asking.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome.
